advice.Acne: Maintain a proper skincare routine, avoid excessive touching of the affected areas, and consider using over-the-counter topical treatments. If severe, consult a dermatologist.
advice.Arthritis: Stay active with gentle exercises, manage weight, and consider pain-relief strategies like hot/cold therapy. Consult a rheumatologist for tailored guidance.
advice.Bronchial Asthma: Follow prescribed inhaler and medication regimen, avoid triggers like smoke and allergens, and have an asthma action plan. Regular check-ups with a pulmonologist are important.
advice.Cervical Spondylosis: Practice good posture, avoid heavy lifting, and consider neck exercises or physical therapy. Consult an orthopedist for specialized care.
advice.Chicken Pox: Avoid scratching the rash, take antihistamines to relieve itching, and ensure rest. Consult a doctor if complications arise.
advice.Common Cold: Stay hydrated, rest, and use over-the-counter medications to relieve symptoms. If persistent, consult a doctor.
advice.Dengue: Stay hydrated, monitor fever, and avoid NSAIDs like ibuprofen. Seek immediate medical attention for severe symptoms.
advice.Dimorphic Hemorrhoids: Maintain a high-fiber diet, stay hydrated, and use prescribed creams or treatments. Consult a proctologist if symptoms persist.
advice.Fungal Infection: Keep affected areas clean and dry, apply antifungal creams, and avoid sharing personal items. Consult a dermatologist for persistent infections.
advice.Hypertension: Monitor blood pressure regularly, maintain a healthy diet, exercise, and reduce stress. Consult a cardiologist for tailored treatment.
advice.Impetigo: Keep the infected area clean, avoid scratching, and use prescribed topical or oral antibiotics. Consult a dermatologist if needed.
advice.Jaundice: Rest, maintain a balanced diet, and avoid alcohol. Consult a hepatologist for liver health management.
advice.Malaria: Follow prescribed antimalarial medication, rest, and stay hydrated. Consult a doctor for proper treatment.
advice.Migraine: Identify and avoid triggers, use prescribed pain relievers, and practice stress-reducing techniques. Consult a neurologist if migraines persist.
advice.Pneumonia: Rest, stay hydrated, and take prescribed antibiotics or antivirals. Regular follow-ups with a pulmonologist may be necessary.
advice.Psoriasis: Keep skin moisturized, avoid triggers like stress, and use prescribed topical treatments. Consult a dermatologist for advanced care.
advice.Typhoid: Maintain hydration, follow a prescribed antibiotic course, and eat light, nutritious food. Consult a doctor for recovery monitoring.
advice.Varicose Veins: Exercise regularly, avoid prolonged standing, and use compression stockings. Consult a vascular specialist for severe cases.
advice.Allergy: Identify and avoid allergens, use antihistamines or prescribed medications, and consult an allergist for severe reactions.
advice.Diabetes: Follow a balanced diet, exercise, monitor blood sugar levels, and take prescribed medications. Regular visits to an endocrinologist are essential.
advice.Drug Reaction: Stop the suspected medication, take antihistamines if mild, and seek immediate medical attention for severe reactions. Consult a doctor for further advice.
advice.Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease: Avoid trigger foods, eat smaller meals, and use prescribed antacids or proton pump inhibitors. Consult a gastroenterologist for persistent symptoms.
advice.Peptic Ulcer Disease: Avoid NSAIDs, alcohol, and spicy foods. Take prescribed medications and consult a gastroenterologist for treatment.
advice.Urinary Tract Infection: Stay hydrated, take prescribed antibiotics, and maintain good hygiene. Consult a doctor for appropriate treatment.
